intro: Navarretia demissa, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a low-growing annual plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Navarretia demissa is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar bell-shaped flowers. Its short life cycle and early blooming period make it an important early-season nectar source for pollinators.
